Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2014 10:13AM CUGymGirl wrote: Heather, I think you are driving yourself crazy my dear. And I say this in the most kind way! I would stop reading and researching because you are only making yourself sick with fear and worry. You should trust what your Drs say, trust what you know so far, and trust in the fact that everything looks benign/non-worrisome...those are all awesome things!! Post away here, chat, etc..while you wait, but I suggest you stop reading and researching..and this comes from a girl who has BTDT in your shoes and I KNOW what you are feeling right now. By the way, I truly believe you are going to get b9 results :)
Posts.Title: i have enlarged lymph node as well as mass help heather37 heather37

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2009 04:40AM CUGymGirl wrote: I know its hard during the waiting process. For me, I had a similar story. I had a mass found that they were 99% sure was benign based on my surgeon and 2 radiologists reports. They suggested a watch and wait for 6 months. I couldn't do that-I had to know so I had a core biopsy done and was very lucky that mine was benign and now I can stop worrying. So talk with your surgeon and see what he suggests and if he gives you the option of a biopsy, Id do it for the peace of mind. Good luck! Carrie

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2009 10:23PM CUGymGirl wrote: I wanted to jump in and say that I also suffered from breast pain for 4 months along with thickened tissue. They found a mass in the area of the pain and thickening and we did a core biopsy. It is called "sclerosing lobular hyperplasia". It is not palpable. Its not overly common but it happens. Another possible option for those seeking info. Carrie :)
